titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Charles Michael, M.D. (1811-1871) was born in Hanover, Pennsylvania, and was a graduate of the Washington Medical College of Baltimore. He practiced medicine in Greencastle, Franklin County, Pennsylvania, from 1832 to 1871.

scopecontent.p: Two manuscript notebooks of notes from medical school lectures, written by Charles Michael in 1829-1830. The first volume is entitled "Notes on Theory and Practice of Medicine by J. H. Miller, M.D." The second volume is "Dr. Handy on Midwifery." The lectures cover topics such as midwifery, opium, typhus fever, hectic fever, Gastrodenia, croup, pathology, and diseases of the chest and lungs.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
